MARINCS 100B.title: Modern Practices in Marine Science
MARINCS 100B.description: This modularized course will introduce students to important topics in modern marine science including treatment of data, scientific ethics, scientific writing, scientific presentations, the practice of interdisciplinary research, and the campus' marine science research portfolio.

MARINCS 102.title: Biological Oceanography
MARINCS 102.description: Current concepts in biological oceanography focusing on the coupling of biotic processes to ocean physics, chemistry and sedimentation. Emphasis on areas of active research with critical evaluation of current and seminal literature.

MARINCS 160AAZZ.title: Marine Science Seminar
MARINCS 160AAZZ.prereq_description: Designed for majors. Non-majors require consent of the instructor to finalize enrollment.
